news.title: Sebi directs asset management companies to form audit committee from August
news.para: Sebi said the decision has been taken after taking into account the recommendation of Mutual Fund Advisory Committee and the feedback received from the industry and has come out with detailed outline for role, responsibility, membership and other features of the Audit Committee of AMC.

news.title: Indiabulls Housing Finance's net profit down 8% to Rs 303 crore in Q3 FY22
news.para: "There was an 8 per cent dip in our profitability as our loan book has come down by 13-14 per cent. As we shrink in size the profitability is expected to diminish," its deputy managing director Ashwini Kumar Hooda said.

news.title: Mobilise resources immediately to begin Supertech twin-tower demolition: Noida authority
news.para: The twin-towers are located in Supertech's Emerald Court society in Sector 93A of the city and were coming up in violation of building bye-laws. The SC had in August last year ordered demolition of the illegal structures within three months.

news.title: ACC's net profit declines 40.5% to Rs 280.85 crore in Q3 FY22
news.para: ACC's total revenue from operations in October-December 2021 stood at Rs 4,225.76 crore, a rise of 1.95 per cent as compared with Rs 4,144.72 crore in the year-ago period.

news.title: Prestige Estates' profit up 59% to Rs 93 crore in Q3 FY22
news.para: New Delhi, Feb 9 (PTI) Realty firm Prestige Estates Projects Ltd on Wednesday reported a 59 per cent increase in its consolidated net profit to Rs 93.3 crore for the quarter ended December.  Its net profit stood at Rs 58.7 crore in the year-ago period.

news.title: Evergrande aims to deliver six lakh apartments in 2022
news.para: Hui Ka Yan told staff in a Sunday meeting that the firm aimed to fully restore construction work across China this month, compared with 93.2% at the end of last year, with a goal of delivering 600,000 apartments in 2022, according to a source with direct knowledge of the matter and media reports.

news.title: Bihar government starts environmental audit of sand ghats
news.para: Officials claimed that there are many environmental rules for sand mining and their compliance is very important. Keeping this in mind, environmental audit of all sand ghats of Bihar has been started.

news.title: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, others to pick up stake in D B Realty
news.para: The company will raise Rs 1,575 crore through issue of warrants in multiple tranches to the promoter group and other investors, as part of its plan to become debt free.

news.title: Kolte-Patil Developers' profit dips 76% to Rs 5.37 crore in Q3 FY22
news.para: Total income rose to Rs 244.7 crore in the third quarter of this fiscal year, from Rs 194.66 crore in the corresponding period of the previous year, according to a regulatory filing.

news.title: Property sales in Indore may touch record high this fiscal
news.para: In January, over 12,000 properties were registered in Indore district that generated revenue of Rs 153 crore, according to the official data.

news.title: Housing finance players loan portfolio to grow at 8-10% in FY22: Report
news.para: After an impact on their disbursements in Q1 FY2022, non-banking financial companies-housing finance companies (NBFC-HFC) saw a sharp recovery in the second quarter. Their on-book portfolio is estimated at Rs 11.6 lakh crore, up 9 per cent year-on-year, in the first half of FY2022.

news.title: Satellite towns proposed to reduce urbanisation load on Shimla
news.para: In the transit oriented development proposal of bypass road and its integration with existing and new development — counter magnet town and satellite towns — are also on the cards.

news.title: Dalmia Nisus Finance exits from Puravankara's Chennai project
news.para: Dalmia Nisus has had invested in the project through its Real Estate Credit Opportunities Fund – I (RECOF – I) in October 2020. The entire investment was repaid by Puravankara after it sold 100% of its stake in the subsidiary companies to a third party.

news.title: Pune: Land developer booked after NRI's complaint
news.para: Police said the NRI stated in his complaint that he had invested money in the Boat Club Road township project in 2015. The land developer and his partner, however, sold the scheme and his share to another builder, keeping him in the dark about the step, the complaint stated.

news.title: Gurugram: Farmers get plots after years of legal battle, find they are up for auction
news.para: In fact, between 1981 and 2000, HSVP acquired hundreds of acres from around 1,500 farmers of Mullahera, Katarpuri, Gurgaon village, Dundahera, Chauma, Basai and Dhankot villages to develop sectors 4, 5, 6, 9, 10, 22 and 23 of Gurgaon.
